name: Coriander Chutney
history: Coriander Chutney, also known as Dhania Chutney, is a staple in Indian cuisine. This chutney is made from fresh coriander leaves and is known for its vibrant green color and refreshing taste. It's a versatile condiment used in various Indian dishes.
description: Coriander Chutney is a fresh and tangy condiment made from coriander leaves, green chilies, lemon juice, and a variety of spices. It's a popular accompaniment to snacks like samosas, sandwiches, and dosas, adding a burst of flavor to any dish.

instructions.title: Blend Ingredients
instructions.description: In a blender, combine coriander leaves, green chilies, lemon juice, garlic, ginger, cumin seeds, sugar, and salt. Add a little water and blend to a smooth consistency.

instructions.title: Adjust Consistency
instructions.description: If the chutney is too thick, add a bit more water and blend again until it reaches the desired consistency.

instructions.title: Serve or Store
instructions.description: Serve the Coriander Chutney immediately or store it in the refrigerator for later use.

tips: Adjust the amount of green chilies based on your spice preference.
Adding a small amount of mint leaves can enhance the flavor.
variations: Include roasted peanuts or coconut for a different texture and taste.
For a tangier chutney, increase the amount of lemon juice.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions.instruction: Coriander Chutney is best served cold and does not require reheating.

presentationTips: Serve in a small bowl with a spoon for easy use.
Garnish with a sprig of coriander for a fresh look.
